{"step_by_step_thinking": "Mucogingival flap designs are used in periodontal surgery. The flap should be wider at the base to ensure adequate blood supply. If the flap is narrower at the base, it may compromise the blood supply leading to necrosis of the flap. The flap margins can rest on bone, as long as the bone is covered by periosteum. Mucogingival flaps are not to be avoided, they are a common and effective surgical technique in periodontics.", "answer_choice": "A"}
